text:
For my own sake, for my own sake, I do it,
    for why should my name be profaned?
    My glory I will not give to another.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to me, O Jacob,
    and Israel, whom I called:
I am he; I am the first,
    and I am the last.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My hand laid the foundation of the earth,
    and my right hand spread out the heavens;
when I summon them,
    they stand at attention.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Assemble, all of you, and hear!
    Who among them has declared these things?
The one the Lord loves shall perform his purpose against Babylon,
    and his arm shall be against the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I, even I, have spoken and called him;
    I have brought him, and he will prosper in his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Draw near to me; hear this!
    From the beginning I have not spoken in secret;
    from the time it came to be I have been there.
And now the Lord God has sent me and his spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord,
    your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel:
I am the Lord your God,
    who teaches you how to succeed,
    who leads you in the way you should go.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
your offspring would have been like the sand
    and your descendants like its grains;
their name would never be cut off
    or destroyed from before me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: “There is no peace,” says the Lord, “for the wicked.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
And he said to me, “You are my servant,
    Israel, in whom I will be glorified.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And now the Lord says,
    who formed me in the womb to be his servant,
to bring Jacob back to him,
    and that Israel might be gathered to him,
for I am honored in the sight of the Lord,
    and my God has become my strength—
speaker: Narrator

text:
he says,
“It is too light a thing that you should be my servant
    to raise up the tribes of Jacob
    and to restore the survivors of Israel;
I will give you as a light to the nations,
    that my salvation may reach to the end of the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord,
    the Redeemer of Israel and his Holy One,
to one deeply despised, abhorred by the nations,
    the slave of rulers,
“Kings shall see and stand up;
    princes, and they shall prostrate themselves,
because of the Lord, who is faithful,
    the Holy One of Israel, who has chosen you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
In a time of favor I have answered you;
    on a day of salvation I have helped you;
I have kept you and given you
    as a covenant to the people,
to establish the land,
    to apportion the desolate heritages,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
they shall not hunger or thirst,
    neither scorching wind nor sun shall strike them down,
for he who has pity on them will lead them
    and by springs of water will guide them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will turn all my mountains into a road,
    and my highways shall be raised up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look, some shall come from far away,
    some from the north and from the west,
    and some from the land of Syene.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing for joy, O heavens, and exult, O earth;
    break forth, O mountains, into singing!
For the Lord has comforted his people
    and will have compassion on his suffering ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Zion said, “The Lord has forsaken me;
    my Lord has forgotten me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can a woman forget her nursing child
    or show no compassion for the child of her womb?
Even these might forget,
    yet I will not forget you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I have inscribed you on the palms of my hands;
    your walls are continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your builders outdo your destroyers,
    and those who laid you waste go away from you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your eyes all around and see;
    they all gather; they come to you.
As I live, says the Lord,
    you shall put all of them on like an ornament,
    and like a bride you shall bind them on.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your wastelands, your desolate places,
    and your devastated land—
now you will be too crowded for your inhabitants,
    and those who swallowed you up will be far away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children born in the time of your bereavement
    will yet say in your hearing:
“The place is too crowded for me;
    make room for me to settle.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you will say in your heart,
    “Who has borne me these?
I was bereaved and barren,
    exiled and put away—
    so who has reared these?
I was left all alone—
    where, then, have these come from?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord God:
I will soon lift up my hand to the nations
    and raise my signal to the peoples,
and they shall bring your sons in their bosom,
    and your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kings shall be your foster fathers
    and their queens your nursing mothers.
With their faces to the ground they shall bow down to you
    and lick the dust of your feet.
Then you will know that I am the Lord;
    those who wait for me shall not be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can the prey be taken from the mighty
    or the captives of a tyrant be rescued?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But thus says the Lord:
Even the captives of the mighty will be taken,
    and the prey of the tyrant will be rescued,
for I will contend with those who contend with you,
    and I will save your children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make your oppressors eat their own flesh,
    and they shall be drunk with their own blood as with wine.
Then all flesh shall know
    that I am the Lord your Savior
    and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
Where is your mother’s bill of divorce
    with which I dismissed her?
Or which of my creditors is it
    to whom I have sold you?
No, because of your sins you were sold,
    and for your transgressions your mother was dismissed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why was no one there when I came?
    Why did no one answer when I called?
Is my arm powerless to redeem?
    Or have I no strength to deliver?
By my rebuke I dry up the sea;
    I make the rivers a desert,
so that their fish stink for lack of water
    and die of thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I clothe the heavens with blackness
    and make sackcloth their covering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God has given me
    a trained tongue,
that I may know how to sustain
    the weary with a word.
Morning by morning he wakens,
    wakens my ear
    to listen as those who are taught.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I gave my back to those who struck me
    and my cheeks to those who pulled out the beard;
I did not hide my face
    from insult and spitting.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
he who vindicates me is near.
Who will contend with me?
    Let us stand in court together.
Who are my adversaries?
    Let them confront me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who among you fears the Lord
    and obeys the voice of his servant,
who walks in darkness
    and has no light,
yet trusts in the name of the Lord
    and relies upon his God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But all of you are kindlers of fire,
    lighters of firebrands.
Walk in the flame of your fire
    and among the brands that you have kindled!
This is what you shall have from my hand:
    you shall lie down in torment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to me, you who pursue righteousness,
    you who seek the Lord.
Look to the rock from which you were hewn
    and to the quarry from which you were dug.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look to Abraham your father
    and to Sarah, who bore you,
for he was but one when I called him,
    but I blessed him and made him many.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Listen to me, my people,
    and give heed to me, my nation,
for a teaching will go out from me
    and my justice for a light to the peoples.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Lift up your eyes to the heavens
    and look at the earth beneath,
for the heavens will vanish like smoke,
    the earth will wear out like a garment,
    and those who live on it will die like gnats,
but my salvation will be forever,
    and my deliverance will never be ended.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to me, you who know righteousness,
    you people who have my teaching in your hearts;
do not fear the reproach of others,
    and do not be dismayed when they revile you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the moth will eat them up like a garment,
    and the worm will eat them like wool,
but my deliverance will be forever
    and my salvation to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake, awake, put on strength,
    O arm of the Lord!
Awake, as in days of old,
    the generations of long ago!
Was it not you who cut Rahab in pieces,
    who pierced the dragon?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Was it not you who dried up the sea,
    the waters of the great deep;
who made the depths of the sea a way
    for the redeemed to cross over?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
You have forgotten the Lord, your Maker,
    who stretched out the heavens
    and laid the foundations of the earth.
You fear continually all day long
    because of the fury of the oppressor,
who is bent on destruction.
    But where is the fury of the oppressor?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For I am the Lord your God,
    who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar—
    the Lord of hosts is his name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have put my words in your mouth
    and hidden you in the shadow of my hand,
stretching out the heavens
    and laying the foundations of the earth
    and saying to Zion, “You are my people.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rouse yourself, rouse yourself!
    Stand up, O Jerusalem,
you who have drunk at the hand of the Lord
    the cup of his wrath,
who have drunk to the dregs
    the cup of staggering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no one to guide her
    among all the children she has borne;
there is no one to take her by the hand
    among all the children she has brought up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These two things have befallen you
    —who will grieve with you?—
devastation and destruction, famine and sword.
    Who will comfort you?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore hear this, you who are wounded,
    who are drunk but not with wine:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says your Sovereign, the Lord,
    your God who pleads the cause of his people:
See, I have taken from your hand the cup of staggering;
you shall drink no more
    from the cup of my wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will put it into the hand of your tormentors,
    who have said to you,
    “Bow down, that we may walk on you,”
and you have made your back like the ground
    and like the street for them to walk on.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake; awake;
    put on your strength, O Zion!
Put on your beautiful garments,
    O Jerusalem, the holy city,
for the uncircumcised and the unclean
    shall enter you no more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shake yourself from the dust; rise up,
    O captive Jerusalem;
loose the bonds from your neck,
    O captive daughter Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord: You were sold for nothing, and you shall be redeemed without money.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord God: Long ago, my people went down into Egypt to reside there as aliens; the Assyrian, too, has oppressed them without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore what am I doing here, says the Lord, seeing that my people are taken away without cause? Their rulers howl, says the Lord, and continually, all day long, my name is despised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my people shall know my name; on that day they shall know that it is I who speak—it is I!
speaker: Narrator

text:
How beautiful upon the mountains
    are the feet of the messenger who announces peace,
who brings good news,
    who announces salvation,
    who says to Zion, “Your God reigns.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen! Your sentinels lift up their voices;
    together they shout for joy,
for in plain sight they see
    the return of the Lord to Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Break forth; shout together for joy,
    you ruins of Jerusalem,
for the Lord has comforted his people;
    he has redeemed Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has bared his holy arm
    before the eyes of all the nations,
and all the ends of the earth shall see
    the salvation of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart, depart, go out from there!
    Touch no unclean thing;
go out from the midst of it; purify yourselves,
    you who carry the vessels of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you shall not go out in haste,
    and you shall not go in flight,
for the Lord will go before you,
    and the God of Israel will be your rear guard.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Just as there were many who were astonished at him
    —so marred was his appearance, beyond human semblance,
    and his form beyond that of mortals—
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who has believed what we have heard?
    And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he grew up before him like a young plant
    and like a root out of dry ground;
he had no form or majesty that we should look at him,
    nothing in his appearance that we should desire him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was despised and rejected by others;
    a man of suffering and acquainted with infirmity,
and as one from whom others hide their faces
    he was despised, and we held him of no account.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely he has borne our infirmities
    and carried our diseases,
yet we accounted him stricken,
    struck down by God, and afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he was wounded for our transgressions,
    crushed for our iniquities;
upon him was the punishment that made us whole,
    and by his bruises we are healed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All we like sheep have gone astray;
    we have all turned to our own way,
and the Lord has laid on him
    the iniquity of us all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was oppressed, and he was afflicted,
    yet he did not open his mouth;
like a lamb that is led to the slaughter
    and like a sheep that before its shearers is silent,
    so he did not open his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By a perversion of justice he was taken away.
    Who could have imagined his future?
For he was cut off from the land of the living,
    stricken for the transgression of my people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They made his grave with the wicked
    and his tomb with the rich,
although he had done no violence,
    and there was no deceit in his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet it was the will of the Lord to crush him with affliction.
When you make his life an offering for sin,
    he shall see his offspring and shall prolong his days;
through him the will of the Lord shall prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Out of his anguish he shall see;
he shall find satisfaction through his knowledge.
    The righteous one, my servant, shall make many righteous,
    and he shall bear their iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I will allot him a portion with the great,
    and he shall divide the spoil with the strong,
because he poured out himself to death
    and was numbered with the transgressors,
yet he bore the sin of many
    and made intercession for the transgressors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shout for joy, O barren one who has borne no children;
    burst into song and shout,
    you who have not been in labor!
For the children of the desolate woman will be more
    than the children of the one who is married, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Enlarge the site of your tent,
    and let the curtains of your habitations be stretched out;
do not hold back; lengthen your cords
    and strengthen your stakes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will spread out to the right and to the left,
    and your descendants will possess nations
    and will settle desolate towns.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the Lord has called you
    like a wife forsaken and grieved in spirit,
like the wife of a man’s youth when she is cast off,
    says your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a brief moment I abandoned you,
    but with great compassion I will gather you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In overflowing wrath for a moment
    I hid my face from you,
but with everlasting love I will have compassion on you,
    says the Lord, your Redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is like the days of Noah to me:
    Just as I swore that the waters of Noah
    would never again go over the earth,
so I have sworn that I will not be angry with you
    and will not rebuke you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the mountains may depart
    and the hills be removed,
but my steadfast love shall not depart from you,
    and my covenant of peace shall not be removed,
    says the Lord, who has compassion on you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O afflicted one, storm-tossed and not comforted,
    I am about to set your stones in antimony
    and lay your foundations with sapphires.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make your pinnacles of rubies,
    your gates of jewels,
    and all your wall of precious stones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your children shall be taught by the Lord,
    and great shall be the prosperity of your children.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
If anyone stirs up strife,
    it is not from me;
whoever stirs up strife with you
    shall fall because of you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, it is I who have created the smith
    who blows the fire of coals
    and produces a weapon fit for its purpose;
I have also created the ravager to destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No weapon that is fashioned against you shall prosper,
    and you shall confute every tongue that rises against you in judgment.
This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord
    and their vindication from me, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why do you spend your money for that which is not bread
    and your earnings for that which does not satisfy?
Listen carefully to me, and eat what is good,
    and delight yourselves in rich food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Incline your ear, and come to me;
    listen, so that you may live.
I will make with you an everlasting covenant,
    my steadfast, sure love for David.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I made him a witness to the peoples,
    a leader and commander for the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now you shall call nations that you do not know,
    and nations that do not know you shall run to you,
because of the Lord your God, the Holy One of Israel,
    for he has glorified you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord while he may be found;
    call upon him while he is near;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For my thoughts are not your thoughts,
    nor are your ways my ways, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as the heavens are higher than the earth,
    so are my ways higher than your ways
    and my thoughts than your thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as the rain and the snow come down from heaven
    and do not return there until they have watered the earth,
making it bring forth and sprout,
    giving seed to the sower and bread to the eater,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so shall my word be that goes out from my mouth;
    it shall not return to me empty,
but it shall accomplish that which I purpose
    and succeed in the thing for which I sent it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you shall go out in joy
    and be led back in peace;
the mountains and the hills before you
    shall burst into song,
    and all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead of the thorn shall come up the cypress;
    instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle,
and it shall be to the Lord for a memorial,
    for an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
    Maintain justice, and do what is right,
for soon my salvation will come
    and my deliverance be revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Happy is the mortal who does this,
    the one who holds it fast,
who keeps the Sabbath, not profaning it,
    and refrains from doing any evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let the foreigner joined to the Lord say,
    “The Lord will surely separate me from his people,”
and do not let the eunuch say,
    “I am just a dry tree.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord:
To the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths,
    who choose the things that please me
    and hold fast my covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give, in my house and within my walls,
    a monument and a name
    better than sons and daughters;
I will give them an everlasting name
    that shall not be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the foreigners who join themselves to the Lord,
    to minister to him, to love the name of the Lord,
    and to be his servants,
all who keep the Sabbath and do not profane it
    and hold fast my covenant—
speaker: Narrator

text:
these I will bring to my holy mountain
    and make them joyful in my house of prayer;
their burnt offerings and their sacrifices
    will be accepted on my altar,
for my house shall be called a house of prayer
    for all peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord God,
    who gathers the outcasts of Israel:
I will gather others to them
    besides those already gathered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All you wild animals,
    all you wild animals in the forest, come to devour!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Come,” they say, “let us get wine;
    let us fill ourselves with strong drink.
And tomorrow will be like today,
    great beyond measure.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous perish,
    and no one considers why;
the devout are taken away,
    while no one understands
    that it is due to evil that the righteous are taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who walk uprightly enter into peace
    and rest on their couches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for you, come here,
    you children of a sorceress,
    you offspring of an adulterer and a prostitute.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whom are you mocking?
    Against whom do you open your mouth wide
    and stick out your tongue?
Are you not children of transgression,
    the offspring of deceit—
speaker: Narrator

text:
you who burn with lust among the oaks,
    under every green tree;
you who slaughter your children in the valleys,
    under the clefts of the rocks?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Upon a high and lofty mountain
    you have set your bed,
    and there you went up to offer sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You journeyed to Molech with oil
    and multiplied your perfumes;
you sent your envoys far away
    and sent them down to Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You grew weary from your many wanderings,
    but you did not say, “It is no use!”
You found your desire rekindled,
    and so you did not weaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whom did you dread and fear
    so that you lied
and did not remember me
    or give me a thought?
Have I not kept silent and closed my eyes,
    and so you do not fear me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will announce your verdict,
    and the objects you made will not help you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you cry out, let your collection of idols deliver you!
    The wind will carry them off;
    a breath will take them away.
But whoever takes refuge in me shall possess the land
    and inherit my holy mountain.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For thus says the high and lofty one
    who inhabits eternity, whose name is Holy:
I dwell in the high and holy place
    and also with those who are contrite and humble in spirit,
to revive the spirit of the humble
    and to revive the heart of the contrite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will not continually accuse,
    nor will I always be angry,
for then the spirits would grow faint before me,
    even the souls that I have made.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I have seen their ways, but I will heal them;
    I will lead them and repay them with comfort,
speaker: Narrator

text:
creating for their mourners the fruit of the lips.
Peace, peace, to the far and the near, says the Lord,
    and I will heal them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: There is no peace, says my God, for the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shout out; do not hold back!
    Lift up your voice like a trumpet!
Announce to my people their rebellion,
    to the house of Jacob their sins.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Why do we fast, but you do not see?
    Why humble ourselves, but you do not notice?”
Look, you serve your own interest on your fast day
    and oppress all your workers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You fast only to quarrel and to fight
    and to strike with a wicked fist.
Such fasting as you do today
    will not make your voice heard on high.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is such the fast that I choose,
    a day to humble oneself?
Is it to bow down the head like a bulrush
    and to lie in sackcloth and ashes?
Will you call this a fast,
    a day acceptable to the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is not this the fast that I choose:
    to loose the bonds of injustice,
    to undo the straps of the yoke,
to let the oppressed go free,
    and to break every yoke?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is it not to share your bread with the hungry
    and bring the homeless poor into your house;
when you see the naked, to cover them
    and not to hide yourself from your own kin?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then you shall call, and the Lord will answer;
    you shall cry for help, and he will say, “Here I am.”
If you remove the yoke from among you,
    the pointing of the finger, the speaking of evil,
speaker: Narrator

text:
if you offer your food to the hungry
    and satisfy the needs of the afflicted,
then your light shall rise in the darkness
    and your gloom be like the noonday.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will guide you continually
    and satisfy your needs in parched places
    and make your bones strong,
and you shall be like a watered garden,
    like a spring of water
    whose waters never fail.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
then you shall take delight in the Lord,
    and I will make you ride upon the heights of the earth;
I will feed you with the heritage of your ancestor Jacob,
    for the mouth of the Lord has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, the Lord’s arm is not too short to save,
    nor his ear too dull to hear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rather, your iniquities have been barriers
    between you and your God,
and your sins have hidden his face from you
    so that he does not hear.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
They hatch adders’ eggs
    and weave the spider’s web;
whoever eats their eggs dies,
    and the crushed egg hatches out a viper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their webs cannot serve as clothing;
    they cannot cover themselves with what they make.
Their works are works of iniquity,
    and deeds of violence are in their hands.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The way of peace they do not know,
    and there is no justice in their ways.
Their roads they have made crooked;
    no one who walks in them knows peace.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
We grope like the blind along a wall,
    groping like those who have no eyes;
we stumble at noon as in the twilight,
    among the vigorous as though we were dead.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For our transgressions before you are many,
    and our sins testify against us.
Our transgressions indeed are with us,
    and we know our iniquities:
speaker: Narrator

text:
transgressing and denying the Lord
    and turning away from following our God,
talking oppression and revolt,
    conceiving lying words and uttering them from the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Justice is turned back,
    and deliverance stands at a distance,
for truth stumbles in the public square,
    and uprightness cannot enter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Truth is lacking,
    and whoever turns from evil is despoiled.
The Lord saw it, and it displeased him
    that there was no justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He saw that there was no one
    and was appalled that there was no one to intervene,
so his own arm brought him victory,
    and his righteousness upheld him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He put on righteousness like a breastplate
    and a helmet of salvation on his head;
he put on garments of vengeance for clothing
    and wrapped himself in fury as in a mantle.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
So those in the west shall fear the name of the Lord,
    and those in the east, his glory,
for he will come like a pent-up stream
    that the wind of the Lord drives on.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he will come to Zion as Redeemer,
    to those in Jacob who turn from transgression, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for me, this is my covenant with them, says the Lord: my spirit that is upon you and my words that I have put in your mouth shall not depart out of your mouth or out of the mouths of your children or out of the mouths of your children’s children, says the Lord, from now on and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, shine, for your light has come,
    and the glory of the Lord has risen upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For darkness shall cover the earth
    and thick darkness the peoples,
but the Lord will arise upon you,
    and his glory will appear over you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nations shall come to your light
    and kings to the brightness of your dawn.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
A multitude of camels shall cover you,
    the young camels of Midian and Ephah;
    all those from Sheba shall come.
They shall bring gold and frankincense
    and shall proclaim the praise of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who are these that fly like a cloud
    and like doves to their windows?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the coastlands shall wait for me,
    the ships of Tarshish first,
to bring your children from far away,
    their silver and gold with them,
for the name of the Lord your God
    and for the Holy One of Israel,
    because he has glorified you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Foreigners shall build up your walls,
    and their kings shall minister to you,
for in my wrath I struck you down,
    but in my favor I have had mercy on you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your gates shall always be open;
    day and night they shall not be shut,
so that nations shall bring you their wealth,
    with their kings led in procession.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The glory of Lebanon shall come to you,
    the cypress, the plane, and the pine,
to beautify the place of my sanctuary,
    and I will glorify where my feet rest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The descendants of those who oppressed you
    shall come bending low to you,
and all who despised you
    shall bow down at your feet;
they shall call you the City of the Lord,
    the Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whereas you have been forsaken and hated,
    with no one passing through,
I will make you majestic forever,
    a joy from age to age.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall suck the milk of nations;
    you shall suck the breasts of kings,
and you shall know that I, the Lord, am your Savior
    and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Violence shall no more be heard in your land,
    devastation or destruction within your borders;
you shall call your walls Salvation
    and your gates Praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun shall no longer be
    your light by day,
nor for brightness shall the moon
    give light to you by night,
but the Lord will be your everlasting light,
    and your God will be your glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your sun shall no more go down
    or your moon withdraw itself,
for the Lord will be your everlasting light,
    and your days of mourning shall be ended.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your people shall all be righteous;
    they shall possess the land forever.
They are the shoot that I planted, the work of my hands,
    so that I might be glorified.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The spirit of the Lord God is upon me
    because the Lord has anointed me;
he has sent me to bring good news to the oppressed,
    to bind up the brokenhearted,
to proclaim liberty to the captives
    and release to the prisoners,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor
    and the day of vengeance of our God,
    to comfort all who mourn,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to provide for those who mourn in Zion—
    to give them a garland instead of ashes,
the oil of gladness instead of mourning,
    the mantle of praise instead of a faint spirit.
They will be called oaks of righteousness,
    the planting of the Lord, to display his glory.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Strangers shall stand and feed your flocks;
    foreigners shall till your land and dress your vines,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Because their shame was double
    and dishonor was proclaimed as their lot,
therefore in their land they shall possess a double portion;
    everlasting joy shall be theirs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I, the Lord, love justice,
    I hate robbery and wrongdoing;
I will faithfully give them their recompense,
    and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their descendants shall be known among the nations
    and their offspring among the peoples;
all who see them shall acknowledge
    that they are a people whom the Lord has blessed.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For as the earth brings forth its shoots
    and as a garden causes what is sown in it to spring up,
so the Lord God will cause righteousness and praise
    to spring up before all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Zion’s sake I will not keep silent,
    and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest,
until her vindication shines out like the dawn
    and her salvation like a burning torch.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations shall see your vindication
    and all the kings your glory,
and you shall be called by a new name
    that the mouth of the Lord will give.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall be a beautiful crown in the hand of the Lord
    and a royal diadem in the hand of your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall no more be termed Forsaken,
    and your land shall no more be termed Desolate,
but you shall be called My Delight Is in Her
    and your land Married,
for the Lord delights in you,
    and your land shall be married.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as a young man marries a young woman,
    so shall your builder marry you,
and as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride,
    so shall your God rejoice over you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Upon your walls, O Jerusalem,
    I have posted sentinels;
all day and all night
    they shall never be silent.
You who remind the Lord,
    take no rest,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and give him no rest
    until he establishes Jerusalem
    and makes it renowned throughout the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has sworn by his right hand
    and by his mighty arm:
I will not again give your grain
    to be food for your enemies,
and foreigners shall not drink the wine
    for which you have labored,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but those who harvest it shall eat it
    and praise the Lord,
and those who gather it shall drink it
    in my holy courts.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord has proclaimed
    to the end of the earth:
Say to daughter Zion,
    “Look, your savior comes;
his reward is with him
    and his recompense before him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall be called, “The Holy People,
    The Redeemed of the Lord,”
and you shall be called, “Sought Out,
    A City Not Forsaken.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Who is this coming from Edom,
    from Bozrah in garments stained crimson?
Who is this so splendidly robed,
    marching in his great might?”
“It is I, announcing vindication,
    mighty to save.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Why are your robes red
    and your garments like theirs who tread the winepress?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the day of vengeance was in my mind,
    and the year for my redeeming work had come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I looked, but there was no helper;
    I was abandoned, and there was no one to sustain me,
so my own arm brought me victory,
    and my wrath sustained me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will recount the gracious deeds of the Lord,
    the praiseworthy acts of the Lord,
because of all that the Lord has done for us
    and the great favor to the house of Israel
that he has shown them according to his mercy,
    according to the abundance of his steadfast love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he said, “Surely they are my people,
    children who will not act deceitfully,”
and he became their savior
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then they remembered the days of old,
    of Moses his servant.
Where is the one who brought them up out of the sea
    with the shepherds of his flock?
Where is the one who put within them
    his holy spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who caused his glorious arm
    to march at the right hand of Moses,
who divided the waters before them
    to make for himself an everlasting name,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who led them through the depths?
Like a horse in the desert,
    they did not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like cattle that go down into the valley,
    the spirit of the Lord gave them rest.
Thus you led your people,
    to make for yourself a glorious name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look down from heaven and see,
    from your holy and glorious habitation.
Where are your zeal and your might?
    Your great pity and your compassion are withheld from me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why, O Lord, do you let us stray from your ways
    and let our heart harden, so that we do not fear you?
Turn back for the sake of your servants,
    the tribes that are your heritage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your holy people took possession for a little while,
    but now our adversaries have trampled down your sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have long been like those whom you do not rule,
    like those not called by your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O that you would tear open the heavens and come down,
    so that the mountains would quake at your presence—
speaker: Narrator

text:
as when fire kindles brushwood
    and the fire causes water to boil—
to make your name known to your adversaries,
    so that the nations might tremble at your presence!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you did awesome deeds that we did not expect,
    you came down; the mountains quaked at your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From ages past no one has heard,
    no ear has perceived,
no eye has seen any God besides you,
    who works for those who wait for him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You meet those who gladly do right,
    those who remember you in your ways.
But you were angry, and we sinned;
    because you hid yourself we transgressed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have all become like one who is unclean,
    and all our righteous deeds are like a filthy cloth.
We all fade like a leaf,
    and our iniquities, like the wind, take us away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no one who calls on your name
    or attempts to take hold of you,
for you have hidden your face from us
    and have delivered us into the hand of our iniquity.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Do not be exceedingly angry, O Lord,
    and do not remember iniquity forever.
    Now consider, we are all your people.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Our holy and beautiful house,
    where our ancestors praised you,
has been burned by fire,
    and all our pleasant places have become ruins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
After all this, will you restrain yourself, O Lord?
    Will you keep silent and punish us so severely?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was ready to be sought out by those who did not ask,
    to be found by those who did not seek me.
I said, “Here I am, here I am,”
    to a nation that did not call on my name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I held out my hands all day long
    to a rebellious people,
who walk in a way that is not good,
    following their own devices;
speaker: Narrator

text:
a people who provoke me
    to my face continually,
sacrificing in gardens
    and offering incense on bricks;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
who say, “Keep to yourself;
    do not come near me, for I am too holy for you.”
These are a smoke in my nostrils,
    a fire that burns all day long.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
their iniquities and their ancestors’ iniquities together,
            says the Lord;
because they offered incense on the mountains
    and reviled me on the hills,
I will measure into their laps
    full payment for their actions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
As the wine is found in the cluster,
    and they say, “Do not destroy it,
    for there is a blessing in it,”
so I will do for my servants’ sake
    and not destroy them all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bring forth descendants from Jacob
    and from Judah inheritors of my mountains;
my chosen shall inherit it,
    and my servants shall settle there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sharon shall become a pasture for flocks
    and the Valley of Achor a place for herds to lie down,
    for my people who have sought me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you who forsake the Lord,
    who forget my holy mountain,
who set a table for Fortune
    and fill cups of mixed wine for Destiny,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will destine you to the sword,
    and all of you shall bow down to the slaughter;
because, when I called, you did not answer,
    when I spoke, you did not listen,
but you did what was evil in my sight
    and chose what I did not delight in.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
my servants shall sing with gladness of heart,
    but you shall cry out in pain of heart
    and shall wail in anguish of spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall leave your name to my chosen to use as a curse,
    and the Lord God will put you to death,
    but to his servants he will give a different name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then whoever invokes a blessing in the land
    shall bless by the God of faithfulness,
and whoever takes an oath in the land
    shall swear by the God of faithfulness,
because the former troubles are forgotten
    and are hidden from my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am about to create new heavens
    and a new earth;
the former things shall not be remembered
    or come to mind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But be glad and rejoice forever
    in what I am creating,
for I am about to create Jerusalem as a joy
    and its people as a delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will rejoice in Jerusalem
    and delight in my people;
no more shall the sound of weeping be heard in it
    or the cry of distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No more shall there be in it
    an infant who lives but a few days
    or an old person who does not live out a lifetime,
for one who dies at a hundred years will be considered a youth,
    and one who falls short of a hundred will be considered accursed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall build houses and inhabit them;
    they shall plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They shall not labor in vain
    or bear children for calamity,
for they shall be offspring blessed by the Lord—
    and their descendants as well.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before they call I will answer,
    while they are yet speaking I will hear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wolf and the lamb shall feed together;
    the lion shall eat straw like the ox,
    but the serpent—its food shall be dust!
They shall not hurt or destroy
    on all my holy mountain,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
Heaven is my throne,
    and the earth is my footstool;
so what kind of house could you build for me,
    what sort of place for me to rest?
speaker: Narrator

text:
All these things my hand has made,
    so all these things are mine,
            says the Lord.
But this is the one to whom I will look,
    to the humble and contrite in spirit
    who trembles at my word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoever slaughters an ox is like one who kills a human,
    whoever sacrifices a lamb like one who breaks a dog’s neck,
whoever presents a grain offering like one who offers pig’s blood,
    whoever makes a memorial offering of frankincense like one who blesses an idol.
Just as these have chosen their own ways
    and in their abominations they take delight,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so I will choose their punishments
    and bring upon them what they fear,
because, when I called, no one answered,
    when I spoke, they did not listen,
but they did what was evil in my sight
    and chose what did not please me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear the word of the Lord,
    you who tremble at his word:
Your own people who hate you
    and reject you for my name’s sake
have said, “Let the Lord be glorified,
    so that we may see your joy,”
    but it is they who shall be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen, a roar from the city!
    A voice from the temple!
The voice of the Lord,
    dealing retribution to his enemies!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before she was in labor
    she gave birth;
before her pain came upon her
    she delivered a son.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who has heard of such a thing?
    Who has seen such things?
Shall a land be born in one day?
    Shall a nation be delivered in one moment?
Yet as soon as Zion was in labor
    she delivered her children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall I open the womb and not deliver?
    says the Lord;
shall I, the one who delivers, shut the womb?
    says your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rejoice with Jerusalem, and be glad for her,
    all you who love her;
rejoice with her in joy,
    all you who mourn over her—
speaker: Narrator

text:
that you may nurse and be satisfied
    from her consoling breast,
that you may drink deeply with delight
    from her glorious bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord:
I will extend prosperity to her like a river
    and the wealth of the nations like an overflowing stream,
and you shall nurse and be carried on her arm
    and bounced on her knees.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You shall see, and your heart shall rejoice;
    your bodies shall flourish like the grass,
and it shall be known that the power of the Lord is with his servants,
    and his indignation is against his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord will come in fire
    and his chariots in a whirlwind,
to vent his anger in fury
    and his rebuke in flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Those who sanctify and purify themselves to go into the gardens, following the one in the center, eating the flesh of pigs, vermin, and rodents, shall come to an end together, says the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for I know their works and their thoughts.
I am coming to gather all nations and tongues, and they shall come and shall see my glory,
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will set a sign among them. From them I will send survivors to the nations, to Tarshish, Put, and Lud, to Meshech, Tubal, and Javan, to the coastlands far away that have not heard of my fame or seen my glory, and they shall declare my glory among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall bring all your kindred from all the nations as an offering to the Lord, on horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and on mules, and on dromedaries, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, says the Lord, just as the Israelites bring a grain offering in a clean vessel to the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will also take some of them as priests and as Levites, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as the new heavens and the new earth,
    which I will make,
shall remain before me, says the Lord,
    so shall your descendants and your name remain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From new moon to new moon
    and from Sabbath to Sabbath,
all flesh shall come to worship before me,
says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall go out and look at the dead bodies of the people who have rebelled against me, for their worm shall not die, their fire shall not be quenched, and they shall be an abhorrence to all flesh.
speaker: Narrator
